thread.title: Canterbury boys and girls, Blackhawk boys and Leo girls soccer regional titleists
thread.title_full: Canterbury boys and girls, Blackhawk boys and Leo girls soccer regional titleists

title: Canterbury boys and girls, Blackhawk boys and Leo girls soccer regional titleists
text:
Canterbury boys and girls, Blackhawk boys and Leo girls soccer regional titleists 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive October 17, 2015 Updated Oct 17, 2015 at 11:29 PM EDT 
UNDATED (21 Alive) - Canterbury's boys and Leo's girts capture 2A soccer regional championships Saturday, as did the Canterbury girls and Blackhawk Christian boys in 1A. 
In the 2A boys regional at Carroll, John Haines, Brandon Renninger, and Gramm Kauffman had the goals in a 3-1 win for Canterbury over Leo, whose lone score came from Dean Ward. 
The Cavs advance to the Warsaw Semi-state. 
Blackhawk Christian won the 1A Whitko Regional with a 5-1 championship game win over Heritage. 
The Braves will play at the Argos Semi-state. 
Morgan Sanderson netted the fifth Leo goal of penalty kicks, and then Alexa Allen stopped the final shot by Homestead's Catie Flory to give the Lions the 1-0 win in penalty kicks in the 2A East Noble girls regional final. 
Leo plays semi-state next week in South Bend. 
Defending 1A state champ Canterbury got three goals from Regan West and two from Sydney Colby in their 8-0 rout of Eastbrook at the 1A Canterbury Regional final. 
The Cavs go to the Laville Semi-state. 
For highlights click on the video icon.
